title: Schedule 3 to, the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 11) (Income Disregard) 
Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2022 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2022.

title: Schedule 3 to, the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent of
heading: 2. Definitions
text_raw:
2. Definitions 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means the Social Welfare Consolidated Claims 
Payments and Control Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 142 of 2007), 

“Regulations of 2022” means the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payment and Control) (Amendment) (No. 10) (Income Disregard) Regulations
text_norm: 2 definition regulations-- principal regulation mean social welfare consolidated claim payment control regulation 2007 (s.i no 142 2007) regulation 2022 mean social welfare (consolidated claim payment control) (amendment) (no 10) (income disregard) regulation

heading: 3. The Principal Regulations are amended—
text_raw:
3. The Principal Regulations are amended— 

(a) 

in article 8(3) (amended by article 3 of the Regulations of 
2022) — 

(i) 

by the deletion of “or” after paragraph (h), 

(ii) by 

the substitution of “person,” for “person.” 

in 

subparagraph (iii) of paragraph (i), and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th September, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [430] 3 

(iii) the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 

(i): 

“or 

(j) any financial contribution paid by the Minister in 
accordance with section 8(1) of the Civil Law 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022.”, 

(b) 

in article 155 (amended by article 3 of the Regulations of 
2022) — 

(i)

in

(iii) 

the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph

“or

accordance with section 8(1) of the Civil Law 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022.”, 

and 

(c) 

in article 174 (amended by article 3 of the Regulations of 
2022) — 

(i) 

by the deletion of “or” after paragraph (n), 

(ii) by the substitution of “person,” for “person.” in paragraph 

(o), and 

(iii) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 

(o): 

“or 

(p) any financial contribution paid by the Minister in 
accordance with section 8(1) of the Civil Law 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022.”. 

 
 
 
 4 [430] 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 July, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 July, 2022. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection.

title: Schedule 3 to, the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005, with the consent of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide that a person who receives a financial contribution 
payment in accordance with section 8(1) of the Civil Law (Miscellaneous 
Provisions) Act 2022, in respect of hosting a temporary protection beneficiary 
(as defined in section 4 of the Act), will be disregarded in the assessment of 
means for the purposes of weekly social assistance payments, increases for 
qualified adults and the Working Family Payment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [430]
